description: The central plaza of Fish-Man Island where the climactic battles between the Straw Hat Pirates and the New Fish-Man Pirates take place.

keyEvents.title: Brook Reveals Soul Abilities at Gyoncorde Plaza
keyEvents.description: Brook demonstrates his mastery over the Yomi Yomi no Mi during his fight with Zeo at Gyoncorde Plaza.
keyEvents.significance: Major location for the Straw Hats' battles against the New Fish-Man Pirates.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Unleashes Red Hawk at Gyoncorde Plaza
keyEvents.description: Luffy debuts his Red Hawk technique at Gyoncorde Plaza, sending Hody Jones flying toward the Noah.
keyEvents.significance: The plaza serves as the battleground for Luffy's first fire-based attack.

statusHistory.reason: Main battle location during Fish-Man Island arc

description: A massive ancient ship located near Fish-Man Island, roughly half the size of the island itself. It is considered a historic treasure of the Ryugu Kingdom.

keyEvents.title: Hody Sent to the Noah by Red Hawk
keyEvents.description: After being hit by Luffy's Red Hawk, Hody Jones is sent flying to the Noah ship where he recovers and consumes more Energy Steroids.
keyEvents.significance: The Noah becomes the location for the continued battle between Luffy and Hody.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Heads to the Noah
keyEvents.description: After sending Hody flying with Red Hawk, Luffy makes his way toward the massive Noah ship to continue the battle.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the transition of the final battle from Gyoncorde Plaza to the Noah.

statusHistory.reason: Becomes the battleground for the final confrontation with Hody

description: An underwater island located 10,000 meters below sea level beneath the Red Line. It is the birthplace of most fish-men and merfolk.

keyEvents.title: Shyarly Advises Children About Prejudice
keyEvents.description: Madam Shyarly tells fish-man children on Fish-Man Island to judge humans with their own eyes rather than inheriting hatred.
keyEvents.significance: Represents the possibility of breaking the cycle of hatred between humans and fish-men.

statusHistory.reason: Ongoing location during the Fish-Man Island arc
